profile_positions.description:
As a GBS Strategy Sr Manager, my role architects, develops and implements a portfolio of S&T initiatives for GBS, a PepsiCo enterprise transformation function. 

Parts of my accountabilities include, but are not limited to: 
>> Develop and execute high-visibility initiatives across all levels of the enterprise, from PepsiCo Executive Committee to GBS Executive Leadership Team partnering and advising throughout the GBS organization for implementation
>> Work with sector, functional and enabling leads to propose strategies, influence buy-in and commitment, and define roadmaps needed to implement initiatives  
>> Oversee the delivery and orchestration of strategy and transformation initiatives across multiple complex, ongoing projects across GBS globally 
>> Be a thought leader in the ongoing establishment and evolution of GBS through sophisticated strategies and complex transformation approaches
profile_positions.title: GBS Global Strategy Sr Manager

profile_positions.description:
The GBS Strategy & Transformation global organization at PepsiCo drives large scale enterprise transformation initiatives to purposely impact PepsiCo's top-line and bottom-line growth.  

As a Global Change Management Lead, my role is to partner with key global stakeholders to plan, deploy and manage transformational strategies, driving adoption and sustainment of the new ways of working across the organization.

As part of my ever-evolving role, I'm the PoC for the LatAm and Europe Change Management teams, and I'm responsible for all GBS related transformations reaching Global HR, Commercial Sales and Finance Planning (from ServiceNow implementation, to engagement plans, retention plans, and roadmap execution, all with a people-centered approach). Additionally, I lead key global initiatives like GBS Strategy Location Playbook creation, GBS Sustainment Framework development, and Winning Hearts & Minds initial roadmap ideation for all PepsiCo associates. Finally, my role includes supporting the recruitment of new talent entering the GBS S&T Global Change Management team.
profile_positions.title: GBS S&T Global Change Management Manager

profile_positions.description:
My role within Accenture has twofold: one as a Solution Architect and the other as a Change & Communication Manager on different implementations. 

As a Solution Architect of the North American region, I’m in charge of:
>> Networking with senior stakeholders (Sr Managers and above) to identify client’s needs
>> Assess how the Communication & Change Management team can support the client’s needs
>> Design the solution needed considering project timeline and singularities 
>> Size the team that will support the client and price the solution 
>> Pitch it to the client and staff the right team once it’s sold

As a Communication & Change Manager, I have led the following projects (selected experience):
>> Communication Manager for SAP Ariba Global Implementation for TD Bank 
May 2020 - Dec 2020
The project is reaching +20,000 users in 3 continents. 
I lead a team of 4.

>> Change Manager for Office 365 Implementation for AB InBev
November 2019 to May 2020
Led the Change Management Workstream following the ADKAR approach on an Office 365 implementation that reached over 10,000 users in 7 different countries during COVID-19. 
I led a team of 6 people specialized in Communication and Learning.
profile_positions.title: Strategy & Consulting, Talent & Organization Manager

profile_positions.description:
As a Talent & Organization Sr Consultant, I have worked on the following projects (selected experience):

>> Adaptive Workforce Team Leader (Accenture Internal Liquid Workforce)
May 2019 – December 2019
Adaptive Workforce is a liquid workforce within Accenture that supports multiple small to medium size projects across North America and Europe. 
As the Team Lead, my role was to interlock with the internal clients, assess their needs and provide an integrated solution that could include change management, communication or talent development & learning activities.
Once projects were sold, I staffed the team that worked following an agile methodology to deliver for the client. It was also my scope of work to oversight the development of every project, handling simultaneous projects at the same time. 
I lead a team of 12 people located on multiple countries (Argentina, Colombia, United States and Poland).

>> Sr Consultant at Global Business Service for Kimberly Clark
May 2018 – May 2019
As a Change Management Lead for this client, I was assigned to the Latin American GBS to partner up with key global, cross-functional stakeholders and being responsible for developing, managing and executing change strategies, while driving adoption and sustainment of new ways of working across the organization focused on the realization of the GSB vision.
During this role, I handled over 11 projects (up to 3 simultaneously), led a time of 3, and relocated to San Jose, Costa Rica (2 months) and Dallas, Texas (1 month).

>>Training Lead for SAP 4/HANA Implementation for BMS 
Development of the Training Needs Assessment, the Training Curricula, the Training Strategy & Plan and the materials to execute it. The implementation reached 5,000 users on the OTC and P2P Lines of Business.

profile_positions.description:
AB Comunicaciones is a Latin American based Consulting Agency specialized in communication and cultural transformations. Within this agency I grew from a Sr. Analyst (3 years on the role) to a Team Leader (2 years on the role). 

My role as a Team Lead included assessing and executing transformational projects by:
>> Doing a Corporate Cultural Diagnosis 
>> Defining a Communication Strategy & Plan to act upon the results from the previous Diagnosis
>> Deploying communication materials to drive the transformation 
>> Measure the impact of the campaign and reinforce or sustain as necessary

I worked for 13 different clients at a regional and global scale, gaining experience of the following industries: Products, Financial Services, Telecommunications and Oil & Gas.   

As a highlight of my experience within AB Comunicaciones, I led an on-the-job health care program for AB InBev that won a FUNDACOM award in 2018. FUNDACOM distinguishes excellence and good practices in public relations and corporate communication produced and disseminated in Spanish and/or Portuguese in the world.
